required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of VX 445/TEZ/IVA in Cystic Fibrosis Subjects 6 Through 11 Years of Age
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3 Study Evaluating the Pharmacokinetics, Safety, and Tolerability of VX-445/TEZ/IVA Triple Combination Therapy in Cystic Fibrosis Subjects 6 Through 11 Years of Age

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the pharmacokinetics (PK), safety, tolerability, efficacy, and pharmacodynamic effect of VX-445, tezacaftor (TEZ), and ivacaftor (IVA) when dosed in triple combination (TC) in Cystic Fibrosis (CF) subjects 6 through 11 years of age with F/F and F/MF genotypes.

primary_outcome.measure: Part A: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of ELX, TEZ, and IVA
Part A: Observed Pre-dose Plasma Concentration (Ctrough) of ELX, TEZ, and IVA
Part A: Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve From 0 to 24 Hours (AUC0-24h) of ELX, TEZ, and IVA
Part B: Safety and Tolerability as Assessed by Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Part B: Day 1 Through Safety Follow-up Visit (up to Week 28)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part A: Cmax of ELX Metabolite (M23-ELX), TEZ Metabolite (M1-TEZ), and IVA Metabolite (M1-IVA)
Part A: Ctrough of ELX Metabolite (M23-ELX), TEZ Metabolite (M1-TEZ), and IVA Metabolite (M1-IVA)
Part A: AUC0-24h of ELX Metabolite (M23-ELX) and TEZ Metabolite (M1-TEZ)
Part A: Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve From 0 to 6 Hours (AUC0-6h) of IVA Metabolite (M1-IVA)
secondary_outcome.description: The AUC data was analyzed for up to 6 hours for IVA metabolite (M1-IVA). Therefore, AUC0-6h is reported for M1-IVA metabolite.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part A: Safety and Tolerability as Assessed by Number of Participants With TEAEs and SAEs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part A: Day 1 Through Safety Follow-up Visit (up to Day 43)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part B: Absolute Change in Percent Predicted Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (ppFEV1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part B: From Baseline Through Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: FEV1 is the volume of air that can forcibly be blown out in one second, after full inspiration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part B: Absolute Change in Sweat Chloride (SwCl)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part B: From Baseline Through Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Sweat samples were collected using an approved collection device.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part B: Absolute Change in Cystic Fibrosis Questionnaire Revised (CFQ-R) Respiratory Domain Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part B: From Baseline Through Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: The CFQ-R is a validated participant-reported outcome measuring health-related quality of life for participants with cystic fibrosis. Respiratory domain assessed respiratory symptoms, score range: 0-100; higher scores indicating fewer symptoms and better health-related quality of life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part B: Absolute Change in Body Mass Index (BMI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part B: From Baseline at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: BMI was defined as weight in kg divided by squared height in meters (m^2).

secondary_outcome.measure: Part B: Absolute Change in BMI For-Age Z-Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part B: From Baseline at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: BMI was defined as weight in kg divided by squared height in meters (m^2). The z-score is a statistical measure to describe whether a value was above or below the standard. A z-score of 0 is equal to the standard. Lower numbers indicate values lower than the standard and higher numbers indicate values higher than the standard.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part B: Absolute Change in Weight
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part B: From Baseline at Week 24

secondary_outcome.measure: Part B: Absolute Change in Weight-for-age Z-Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part B: From Baseline at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: The z-score is a statistical measure to describe whether a value was above or below the standard. A z-score of 0 is equal to the standard. Lower numbers indicate values lower than the standard and higher numbers indicate values higher than the standard.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part B: Absolute Change in Height
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part B: From Baseline at Week 24

secondary_outcome.measure: Part B: Absolute Change in Height-for-Age Z-Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part B: From Baseline at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: The z-score is a statistical measure to describe whether a value was above or below the standard. A z-score of 0 is equal to the standard. Lower numbers indicate values lower than the standard and higher numbers indicate values higher than the standard.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part B: Drug Acceptability Assessment Using Modified Facial Hedonic Scale
secondary_outcome.description: The study drug acceptability (participant reaction) was assessed by a visual analog scale that incorporates a 5 point facial hedonic scale (Liked it Very Much, Liked it a Little, Not sure, Disliked it a Little, Disliked it Very Much). Number of participants with the indicated categorical response in the drug acceptability assessment were reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part B: Number of Pulmonary Exacerbations Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part B: From Baseline Through Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Pulmonary exacerbation was defined as new or changed treatment with oral, inhaled, or intravenous antibiotics and fulfillment of pre-specified protocol defined criteria. The total number of pulmonary exacerbations events across all participants were reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part B: Number of CF Related Hospitalizations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part B: From Baseline Through Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of CF related hospitalization events across all participants were reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part B: Ctrough of ELX, ELX Metabolite (M23-ELX), TEZ, TEZ Metabolite (M1-TEZ), IVA and IVA Metabolite (M1-IVA)
Part B: Absolute Change in Lung Clearance Index 2.5 (LCI2.5)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part B: From Baseline Through Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: LCI 2.5 represents the number of lung turnovers required to reduce the end tidal inert gas concentration to 1/40th of its starting value.

arm_group.description: Participants in Part A received ELX 100 milligrams (mg) once daily (qd)/TEZ 50 mg qd/IVA 75 mg every 12 hours (q12h) in the treatment period for 15 days.

Participants in Part B weighing less than (<) 30 kilograms (kg) at Day 1 received ELX 100 mg qd/TEZ 50 mg qd/IVA 75 mg q12h and participants weighing greater than equals to (>=) 30 kg at Day 1 received ELX 200 mg qd/TEZ 100 mg qd/IVA 150 mg q12h in the treatment period for 24 weeks.

intervention.description: Fixed-dose combination tablet orally once daily in the morning.
IVA tablet orally once daily in the evening.

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Homozygous or heterozygous for F508del mutation (F/F or F/MF genotypes)
- Forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1) value â‰¥40% of predicted mean for age, sex, and height.
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinically significant cirrhosis with or without portal hypertension
- Lung infection with organisms associated with a more rapid decline in pulmonary status.
- Solid organ or hematological transplantation.
Other protocol defined Inclusion/Exclusion criteria may apply.

facility.name: Ann & Robert Lurie Children's Hospital of Chicago
Children's Respiratory and Critical Care Specialists, P.A., Children's Hospitals and Clinics of Minnesota
Northwell Health- Long Island Jewish Medical Center
Rainbow Babies and Children's Hospital/University Hospitals Cleveland Medical Center
Children's Health Ireland at Temple Street
Royal Brompton & Harefield NHS Foundation Trust, Royal Brompton Hospital

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted in 2 parts, Part A and Part B. All results were planned to be analyzed and reported separately for Part A and Part B of the study.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: This study was conducted in cystic fibrosis (CF) participants 6 through 11 years of age who were homozygous for F508del (F/F) genotype or heterozygous for F508del and a CF transmembrane conductance regulator gene (CFTR) minimal function mutation (F/MF) genotypes.

group.title: Part A: ELX/TEZ/IVA
group.description: Participants in Part A received elexacaftor (ELX) 100 milligrams (mg) once daily (qd)/tezacaftor (TEZ) 50 mg qd/ivacaftor (IVA) 75 mg every 12 hours (q12h) in the treatment period for 15 days.

group.title: Part B: ELX/TEZ/IVA
group.description: Participants in Part B weighing less than (<) 30 kilograms (kg) at Day 1 received ELX 100 mg qd/TEZ 50 mg qd/IVA 75 mg q12h and participants weighing greater than equals to (>=) 30 kg at Day 1 received ELX 200 mg qd/TEZ 100 mg qd/IVA 150 mg q12h in the treatment period for 24 weeks.

participants_list.participants: Out of the 16 participants from Part A, 11 participants also participated in Part B of the study.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Withdrawal of consent (not due to AE)

baseline.population: The analysis population included all enrolled participants who carry the intended CFTR allele mutation and received at least 1 dose of study drug in the respective part of the study.

group.title: ELX/TEZ/IVA
group.description: Part A: Participants in Part A received ELX 100 mg qd/TEZ 50 mg qd/IVA 75 mg q12h in the treatment period for 15 days. Part B: Participants in Part B weighing <30 kg at Day 1 received ELX 100 mg qd/TEZ 50 mg qd/IVA 75 mg q12h and participants weighing >=30 kg at Day 1 received ELX 200 mg qd/TEZ 100 mg qd/IVA 150 mg q12h in the treatment period for 24 weeks.

measure.title: Age
measure.population: Data were planned to be analyzed and reported separately for Part A and Part B of the study. Here "number analyzed" signifies participants who were evaluable for specified part of the study.

measure.title: Sex: Female, Male
measure.population: Data were planned to be analyzed and reported separately for Part A and Part B of the study. Here "number analyzed" signifies participants who were evaluable for specified part of the study.

measure.title: Ethnicity (NIH/OMB)
measure.population: Data were planned to be analyzed and reported separately for Part A and Part B of the study. Here "number analyzed" signifies participants who were evaluable for specified part of the study.

measure.title: Race (NIH/OMB)
measure.population: Data were planned to be analyzed and reported separately for Part A and Part B of the study. Here "number analyzed" signifies participants who were evaluable for specified part of the study.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) set for Part A included all participants who have received at least 1 dose of study drug in Part A. Here, the "number analyzed" signifies participants who were evaluable at the specified time point. This outcome measure was planned only for Part A arm.

outcome.title: Part B: Safety and Tolerability as Assessed by Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.time_frame: Part B: Day 1 Through Safety Follow-up Visit (up to Week 28)
outcome.population: Safety set for Part B included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug in Part B. The safety and tolerability analysis for Part B was assessed for the overall treatment arm, irrespective of weight based dose regimen. Therefore, the analysis is reported for the single triple combination (Part B: ELX/TEZ/IVA) arm.

group.title: Part B: ELX/TEZ/IVA
group.description: Participants in Part B weighing <30 kg at Day 1 received ELX 100 mg qd/TEZ 50 mg qd/IVA 75 mg q12h and participants weighing >=30 kg at Day 1 received ELX 200 mg qd/TEZ 100 mg qd/IVA 150 mg q12h in the treatment period for 24 weeks.

Therefore, the analysis is reported for the single triple combination (Part B: ELX/TEZ/IVA) arm.

outcome.title: Part B: Absolute Change in Percent Predicted Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (ppFEV1)
outcome.description: FEV1 is the volume of air that can forcibly be blown out in one second, after full inspiration.
outcome.time_frame: Part B: From Baseline Through Week 24
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS) for Part B included all enrolled participants who carry the intended CFTR allele mutation and received at least 1 dose of study drug in Part B. The efficacy analysis for Part B was assessed for the overall treatment arm, irrespective of weight based dose regimen. Therefore, the analysis is reported for the single triple combination (Part B: ELX/TEZ/IVA) arm.

group.title: Part B: ELX/TEZ/IVA
group.description: Participants in Part B weighing <30 kg at Day 1 received ELX 100 mg qd/TEZ 50 mg qd/IVA 75 mg q12h and participants weighing >=30 kg at Day 1 received ELX 200 mg qd/TEZ 100 mg qd/IVA 150 mg q12h in the treatment period for 24 weeks.

The efficacy analysis for Part B was assessed for the overall treatment arm, irrespective of weight based dose regimen. Therefore, the analysis is reported for the single triple combination (Part B: ELX/TEZ/IVA) arm.

outcome.description: The z-score is a statistical measure to describe whether a value was above or below the standard. A z-score of 0 is equal to the standard. Lower numbers indicate values lower than the standard and higher numbers indicate values higher than the standard.
outcome.time_frame: Part B: From Baseline at Week 24
outcome.population: FAS (Part B). The efficacy analysis for Part B was assessed for the overall treatment arm, irrespective of weight based dose regimen. Therefore, the analysis is reported for the single triple combination (Part B: ELX/TEZ/IVA) arm.

group.title: Part B: ELX/TEZ/IVA
group.description: Participants in Part B weighing <30 kg at Day 1 received ELX 100 mg qd/TEZ 50 mg qd/IVA 75 mg q12h and participants weighing >=30 kg at Day 1 received ELX 200 mg qd/TEZ 100 mg qd/IVA 150 mg q12h in the treatment period for 24 weeks.

measure.title: Part B: Absolute Change in Height-for-Age Z-Score
measure.description: The z-score is a statistical measure to describe whether a value was above or below the standard. A z-score of 0 is equal to the standard. Lower numbers indicate values lower than the standard and higher numbers indicate values higher than the standard.
measure.population: FAS (Part B). The efficacy analysis for Part B was assessed for the overall treatment arm, irrespective of weight based dose regimen. Therefore, the analysis is reported for the single triple combination (Part B: ELX/TEZ/IVA) arm.

outcome.title: Part B: Drug Acceptability Assessment Using Modified Facial Hedonic Scale
outcome.description: The study drug acceptability (participant reaction) was assessed by a visual analog scale that incorporates a 5 point facial hedonic scale (Liked it Very Much, Liked it a Little, Not sure, Disliked it a Little, Disliked it Very Much). Number of participants with the indicated categorical response in the drug acceptability assessment were reported.
outcome.time_frame: Part B: At Week 24
outcome.population: FAS (Part B). The efficacy analysis for Part B was assessed for the overall treatment arm, irrespective of weight based dose regimen. Therefore, the analysis is reported for the single triple combination (Part B: ELX/TEZ/IVA) arm. Here "Overall Number of Participants Analyzed" signifies those participants who were evaluable for this outcome.

group.title: Part B: ELX/TEZ/IVA
group.description: Participants in Part B weighing <30 kg at Day 1 received ELX 100 mg qd/TEZ 50 mg qd/IVA 75 mg q12h and participants weighing >=30 kg at Day 1 received ELX 200 mg qd/TEZ 100 mg qd/IVA 150 mg q12h in the treatment period for 24 weeks.

measure.title: Part B: Drug Acceptability Assessment Using Modified Facial Hedonic Scale
measure.description: The study drug acceptability (participant reaction) was assessed by a visual analog scale that incorporates a 5 point facial hedonic scale (Liked it Very Much, Liked it a Little, Not sure, Disliked it a Little, Disliked it Very Much). Number of participants with the indicated categorical response in the drug acceptability assessment were reported.
measure.population: FAS (Part B). The efficacy analysis for Part B was assessed for the overall treatment arm, irrespective of weight based dose regimen. Therefore, the analysis is reported for the single triple combination (Part B: ELX/TEZ/IVA) arm. Here "Overall Number of Participants Analyzed" signifies those participants who were evaluable for this outcome.

outcome.title: Part B: Number of Pulmonary Exacerbations Events
outcome.description: Pulmonary exacerbation was defined as new or changed treatment with oral, inhaled, or intravenous antibiotics and fulfillment of pre-specified protocol defined criteria. The total number of pulmonary exacerbations events across all participants were reported.
outcome.time_frame: Part B: From Baseline Through Week 24
outcome.population: FAS (Part B). The efficacy analysis for Part B was assessed for the overall treatment arm, irrespective of weight based dose regimen. Therefore, the analysis is reported for the single triple combination (Part B: ELX/TEZ/IVA) arm.

group.title: Part B: ELX/TEZ/IVA
group.description: Participants in Part B weighing <30 kg at Day 1 received ELX 100 mg qd/TEZ 50 mg qd/IVA 75 mg q12h and participants weighing >=30 kg at Day 1 received ELX 200 mg qd/TEZ 100 mg qd/IVA 150 mg q12h in the treatment period for 24 weeks.

measure.title: Part B: Number of Pulmonary Exacerbations Events
measure.description: Pulmonary exacerbation was defined as new or changed treatment with oral, inhaled, or intravenous antibiotics and fulfillment of pre-specified protocol defined criteria. The total number of pulmonary exacerbations events across all participants were reported.
measure.population: FAS (Part B). The efficacy analysis for Part B was assessed for the overall treatment arm, irrespective of weight based dose regimen. Therefore, the analysis is reported for the single triple combination (Part B: ELX/TEZ/IVA) arm.

outcome.title: Part B: Number of CF Related Hospitalizations
outcome.description: The total number of CF related hospitalization events across all participants were reported.

outcome.population: FAS (Part B). The efficacy analysis for Part B was assessed for the overall treatment arm, irrespective of weight based dose regimen. Therefore, the analysis is reported for the single triple combination (Part B: ELX/TEZ/IVA) arm.

outcome.title: Part B: Ctrough of ELX, ELX Metabolite (M23-ELX), TEZ, TEZ Metabolite (M1-TEZ), IVA and IVA Metabolite (M1-IVA)
outcome.time_frame: Part B: At Week 4
outcome.population: The PK set for Part B included all participants who have received at least 1 dose of study drug in Part B. Here "number analyzed" signifies those participants who were evaluable at specified time points.

group.description: Participants in Part B weighing <30 kg at Day 1 received ELX 100 mg qd/TEZ 50 mg qd/IVA 75 mg q12h and participants weighing >=30 kg at Day 1 received ELX 200 mg qd/TEZ 100 mg qd/IVA 150 mg q12h in the treatment period for 24 weeks.

measure.population: The PK set for Part B included all participants who have received at least 1 dose of study drug in Part B. Here "number analyzed" signifies those participants who were evaluable at specified time points.

outcome.title: Part B: Absolute Change in Lung Clearance Index 2.5 (LCI2.5)
outcome.description: LCI 2.5 represents the number of lung turnovers required to reduce the end tidal inert gas concentration to 1/40th of its starting value.
outcome.time_frame: Part B: From Baseline Through Week 24
outcome.population: FAS (Part B). The efficacy analysis for Part B was assessed for the overall treatment arm, irrespective of weight based dose regimen. Therefore, the analysis is reported for the single triple combination (Part B: ELX/TEZ/IVA) arm.

measure.description: LCI 2.5 represents the number of lung turnovers required to reduce the end tidal inert gas concentration to 1/40th of its starting value.
measure.population: FAS (Part B). The efficacy analysis for Part B was assessed for the overall treatment arm, irrespective of weight based dose regimen. Therefore, the analysis is reported for the single triple combination (Part B: ELX/TEZ/IVA) arm.

reported_events.time_frame: Day 1 Through Safety Follow-up Visit (up to Day 43 for Part A, up to Week 28 for Part B)
reported_events.desc: The safety analysis for Part B was assessed for the overall treatment arm, irrespective of weight based dose regimen. Therefore, the analysis is reported for the single triple combination (Part B: ELX/TEZ/IVA) arm. MedDRA version 21.1 applied for Part A, MedDRA version 23.0 applied for Part B.

group.title: Part A: ELX/TEZ/IVA
group.description: Participants in Part A received ELX 100 mg qd/TEZ 50 mg qd/IVA 75 mg q12h in the treatment period for 15 days.

group.title: Part B: ELX/TEZ/IVA
group.description: Participants in Part B weighing <30 kg at Day 1 received ELX 100 mg qd/TEZ 50 mg qd/IVA 75 mg q12h and participants weighing >=30 kg at Day 1 received ELX 200 mg qd/TEZ 100 mg qd/IVA 150 mg q12h in the treatment period for 24 weeks.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
